newEscrow(uint256,address,address,addres.details: msg.sender must approve the token contract to spend the price amount before calling this function.There is a risk that if a malicious token is used, the dispute process could be manipulated. Therefore, careful consideration should be taken when chosing the token.

params.arbiter: the address of the arbiter. This is the one who will resolve disputes.
params.arbiterFee: the fee the arbiter will receive for resolving disputes.
params.price: the price of the escrow. This is the agreed upon price for this service.
params.salt: the salt to use for the escrow contract. This is used to prevent replay attacks.
params.seller: the address of the seller. This is the one receiving the tokens.
params.tokenContract: the address of the token contract to use for this escrow, ie USDC, WETH, DAI, etc.

returns._0: the address of the newly deployed escrow contract.

newEscrow(uint256,address,address,addres.notice: deploy a new escrow contract. The escrow will hold all the funds. The buyer is whoever calls this function.
